remarks: The domain of definition of the internal direct product, which states that ` S ` is a family of subgroups that mutually commute and have trivial intersections.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.) Obsolete version of ~ eldprdi as of 14-Jul-2019. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)

eldprdiOLD.2 $e |- ( ph -> dom S = I ) $.
eldprdiOLD.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. W ) $.
eldprdiOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) e. ( G DProd S ) ) $.
